feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Apps
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Apps Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Unable to see list data when I run the app
entry.content:
Hello,

So I am getting records from Salesforce and storing in a data variable and trying to display it on the SAP Build Apps.
When I configure the settings, I can see it in the app showing data while development but when I run a preview and try to run from my mobile, it is blank. I cannot see anything.

When I try to run a single record without repeat then it works perfectly fine.
Can anybody help me with what I am missing?

As you can see, I can see the data here coming from the salesforce based on my scan query but I cannot see it when I do a preview and run on my app.

Regards,
Ankita Mundhra

entry.title: Start and Stop recording audio not working in web app(chrome) using spa build apps
entry.content:
Hi Team,
I have successfully been able to implement audio recording in my mobile apps using the start recording audio and stop recording audio flow functions. But when I try to use the same flow functions in my web app. I keep getting errors such as:

- Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'audioFile') 

-Failed to execute 'requestData' on 'MediaRecorder': The MediaRecorder's state is 'inactive'.

Does anyone know how to record audio and get the audio file within SAP Build Apps community edition?

entry.title: build apps community edition builds to 99%, then says unknown error contact support
entry.content: Build Apps Community edition, gets to 99% in build process, then after about an hour says error unknown, contact support

entry.title: SAP Build Apps build error
entry.content:
SAP Build Apps, Community edition error when building. Get to 99% and after 1 hr it breaks giving an error of :

Error unknown, contact support.

Here is the error report as supplied by the builder;

{"buildId":"ee69cb9a-af44-4934-ad0b-44bb0357b9fc","appId":"226370","buildLogError":null}

I posted a similar query on wednesday, and even though there have been a lot of views, I have not received any response. My question now is;

Does Build Apps support monitor this board? 

Could this error be due to the fact that I am using the Community edition. If this is the case, please could someone recommend how to upgrade to another edition, as I would really like to continue using SAP Build Apps.

entry.title: Accessing deployed SAP Build Apps app in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello, how does deploying a SAP Build Apps app work? It seems to generate a URL when deployed via BTP. Is the app located in a Workzone?

Is it possible to use a deployed app's URL to access it via SAP Public Cloud Custom tile? If so, I imagine that the browser would open a new window  with the Build App application... Is it possible to open the custom made app within the SAP Public Cloud window? Similarly to how other native Public Cloud apps work?

How suitable SAP Build Apps even is as an extensibility option for SAP Public Cloud?

Thank you.

entry.title: add data variable option is disabled in sap build apps
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am new to SAP Build Apps, trying to create an app, however, add data variable option is disabled in sap build apps. Expecting experts advice. Thank you in advance.

entry.title: List Item Not Repeating Data in SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm trying to create a simple list view to display the item's warehouse availability, similar to how SAP B1 does in the Stock tab of Item Master Data.

In there, basic fields such as warehouse code, in stock, committed, and ordered. The input comes from a scanned barcode, which in turn is associated with the Item Master. Fetching header-level data is fine. I managed to get Item Code, Item Name, and I could get any other data from the same level. But when it comes to nested data, in this case, warehouse data related to the item, I got stuck. I describe how I set up the data source and how I am managing data/page variables:

Data Source

In this system, we are using SAP Cloud Connector to link BTP to our On-Premise landscape. We created a destination called SBOSL, which points to the Service Layer root endpoint, whereby all exposed entities can be used. SBOSL then gets available as data source in SAP Build Apps, and all I had to do was enabling the entities I wanted to work with. In this case, Items. It seems to be a rather straightforward manner to source data, as we have no need to create and manage API calls by setting up headers, body, parameter, etc. Everything is handled through the UI.

Data Variables

I have set a data variable called itemByBarcode, from the type "Collection of data records". Here, I configured a filter condition (where Barcode = scannedBarcode), and the fields as List of Values (ItemCode, ItemName, BarCode, ItemWarehouseInfoCollection).

Logic

The current logic consists on:

  1. Scan Barcode
  2. Store the scanned barcode in the page variable scannedBarcode
  3. Get Record Collection by using scannedBarcode variable
  4. Bind a data variable node to the itemByBarcode data variable

List Item

We added a list item called Warehouse List, and bind the "Repeat With" property to the formula data.itemByBarcode[0].ItemWarehouseInfoCollection. Inside of the list item, we placed a row with 4 cells, and each cell includes a text element where the warehouse data goes in (warehouse code, in stock, committed, ordered). The tree points to Row > Cell > Text, so there is no container aggregating the elements, which could potentially block the data flow.

The problem is that, even setting up the repeater in the outer list, I cannot see the individual fields to bind to each warehouse field, such as warehouse code, in stock, and so on. I tried to hardcode it via formula (e.g. current.WhsCode), but it doesn't work, as expected.

Also tried to bind via Data Item to repeat, and the nested data (Item > ItemWarehouseInfoCollection) doesn't appear to be available.

Outcomes

When previewing the App, at least I can see that the quantity of lines printed matches SAP. I even added a text to debug how many records are being fetch (quantity of warehouses), and it also matches (5), but the data itself still doesn't show up in the list.

Any comments or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in anticipation!

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: SAP Build - Get Record fetches data but properties are blank when I try to read them
entry.content:
Hey,

I'm trying to read a single data record into an app or data variable. The API works and fetches the data.

So when I output the record, I do get the object with all of the information and properties. However, when I try to read or bind one of the properties of that object to a field or variable, the result is always empty. Same thing happens when I use the Get record / Record output to bind it to a variable that was created from the same entity.

I just use the basic Get record and Set data variable/Set app variable logic.

Thanks for your help!

entry.title: Building an AI-Powered Assistant with SAP AI Core and SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In today’s rapidly evolving digital landscape, AI-powered assistants have emerged as indispensable assets for businesses aiming to elevate customer service, increase productivity, and optimize operations. This comprehensive guide will walk you through the process of building a sophisticated AI assistant using SAP AI Core and SAP Build Apps—a powerful, no-code combination that empowers users to harness enterprise-grade AI capabilities without the need for traditional programming expertise.

Architecture Overview

  1. SAP Build Apps: Serves as the front-end development platform for crafting intuitive user interfaces
  2. SAP AI Core: Acts as the robust runtime engine that executes AI workloads and delivers foundation model capabilities
  3. BTP Destination: Functions as the middleware layer that securely connects Build Apps to AI Core, ensuring smooth and scalable integration.

The integration flow works as follows:

Users engage with the application through the intuitive SAP Build Apps interface. When an input is submitted, it is seamlessly transmitted via BTP Destinations to SAP AI Core, which orchestrates the request. AI Core then processes the input using the powerful GPT-4o model hosted on Azure OpenAI. Once the AI generates a response, the result is returned through the same secure channel and elegantly displayed within the Build Apps interface for the user.

Prerequisites

  1. SAP BTP account (free tier)
  2. Access to SAP AI Core with sap-internal or extended service plan
  3. SAP Build Apps subscription
  4. SAP AI Launchpad subscription

Step 1: Setting Up Your SAP BTP Environment

Enable Required Services or Applications

  1. Navigate to your SAP BTP Global Account
  2. Go to Instances and Subscriptions section
  3. Search for and enable these applications:
    • AI Launchpad
    • AI Core
    • Build Apps

Subscribe to SAP Build Apps 

Create AI Core Instance

  1. In your sub-account, go to Services > Instances and Subscriptions
  2. Create a new instance of AI Core
  3. Choose the extended or sap-internal service plan (required for foundation models)
  4. Create a service key for the AI Core instance - save this information as you'll need it later

Step 2: Configure SAP AI Launchpad

Create Connection to AI Core

  1. Open SAP AI Launchpad
  2. Navigate to the Connections section
  3. Create a new connection using the service key information from Step 1
  4. Create a workspace (you can use "default" as the name)

Set Up Foundation Models

  1. In AI Launchpad, go to ML Operations > Scenarios
  2. You should see Foundation Models - these are pre-configured scenarios provided by SAP.

Deploy the Model

  1. Go to Deployments and click Create
  2. Select your configuration
  3. Choose Standard duration (or custom if you prefer)
  4. Wait for the deployment status to show Running - this may take a few minutes

Step 3: Create BTP Destination

The destination acts as a bridge between Build Apps and AI Core.

  1. In BTP Cockpit, go to Connectivity > Destinations
  2. Click New Destination and configure like below in screenshot and add the additional properties as well:

Additional Properties:

HTML5.DynamicDestinationtrue
URL.headers.AI-Resource-Groupdefault
AppGyver.Enabledtrue
URL.headers.Content-Type application/json

Step 4: Build the Chatbot Interface with SAP Build Apps

Create New Project

  1. Open SAP Build Apps
  2. Click Create > Build an Application
  3. Choose Web & Mobile Application
  4. Name your project: Virtual Assistant

Design the User Interface

  1. Remove all the previous elements from the UI
  2. Add a Large Image List Item for displaying chat history
  3. Modify the list item:
  4. Add an Input Field for user messages (remove the label)
  5. Add a Button with label "Submit"

Create Variables

Create these variables to manage data flow:

  1. App Variable:
    • history (List of objects)
      • role (Text)
      • content (Text)

  1. Page Variable: input
    • Type: Text
    • Purpose: Capture user input

Step 5: Set Up Data Integration

Create Data Entity

  1. Go to Integrations tab
  2. Select SAP BTP Destination REST API integration
  3. Configure:
    • Name: ai-assistant-tool
    • Destination: Select your created destination (ai-destination)
    • Resource Schema: Create list of objects with role and content properties

Configure API Endpoint

  1. Enable the Create method (for POST requests)
  2. Set the relative URL: /inference/deployments/[DEPLOYMENT_ID]/chat/completions?api-version=2024-06-01 
    • Get the deployment ID from your AI Launchpad deployment URL

Test the Connection

Create Data Variable

  1. Create a Data Variable using your data entity
  2. This will handle the communication with AI Core

Step 6: Implement Chatbot Logic

Bind UI Components

  1. Bind List Component:
    • Select the Large Image List Item
    • Bind Repeat with to app variable: history
    • Bind Title to data item: role
    • Bind Description to data item: content
  2. Bind Input Field:
    • Bind Value to page variable: input

Add Button Logic

Create the following logic flow for the Send button:

Set App Variable ->  Create Record -> Set App Variable (for response) -> Set Page Variable:

Step 7: Testing Your Chatbot

Web Testing

  1. Use the Preview feature in Build Apps
  2. Test various scenarios

Mobile Testing

  1. Install the SAP Build Apps mobile app
  2. Scan the QR code from your project
  3. Test on both iOS and Android devices

 

Conclusion

You’ve now developed a sophisticated AI-powered assistant using SAP’s low-code/no-code platform — a clear demonstration of how SAP Build Apps intuitive interface design seamlessly integrates with the advanced AI capabilities of SAP AI Core.

The assistant you've created goes beyond a basic Q&A tool. It’s a flexible, scalable solution that can be tailored to a wide range of business scenarios. Whether your goal is to enhance customer service, streamline internal operations, or deliver personalized learning experiences, this solution provides a solid foundation for building intelligent, enterprise-ready applications.

entry.title: Moving Gmail Inbox Emails to Subfolders Using Message ID in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content: Hi  Everyone , I am currently working with SAP Build Process Automation on a use case where I need to manage Gmail emails. The requirement is to identify an email in the Inbox using the unique Message ID provided by Gmail and then move this email from the Inbox to a custom subfolder within the Inbox. I have tried using the Move Email (Online) activity, but I am facing challenges as the activity does not seem to recognize the custom subfolder, and the process fails when I attempt to move the email using the Message ID. I would like to know the recommended approach for fetching Gmail emails based on Message ID and the correct way to configure the target folder path when moving emails into subfolders or labels. Any guidance, best practices, or configuration examples from the community would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Network error on Sap Build
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a mobile application which I made with Sap Build Web and Mobile Application( formerly known as Appgywer ). I am using an oData service on my app. It was working fine but suddenly oData service started to throw exception as "Network Error Axios Error: Network Error". 

Does anybody face same issue?

Best regards.

entry.title: Facing issue while filtering data in sap build apps using get record collection
entry.content:
Hi,
I'm facing issue while filtering data using get record collection. In filter condition of get record collection if i bind the compared value to a variable then filtering is not working 

If i provide a  value in compared value then the filtering is working 

Please suggest any solution for this issue.

Thanks,

Priyanka.

entry.title: Page Mounted Event not called in published app
entry.content:
Hey,

I implemented some logic that a record collection is called when the page was mounted.

In the preview this works just fine, but when I publish the app, it seems like the event istn't even called. I placed toast after every action in the logic tab and the first toasts (after Page mounted & Page focused) aren't showing up.

Did someone have this issue before?

entry.content:

I got an object, which is transformed into a JSON Object and mapped to the output parameter: 

Afterwards I'm mapping this to a app variable: 

Everytime I'm calling the function, all the other information are loaded, but only the urgency is not set:

The Javascript Log shows the right information (medium) but the frontend only shows undefined:

Any idea? 

 

BR

entry.title: Help Needed : Your apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I recently received a notification from Google Play stating that my apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements.

Here is the message from Google Play :

3 of your apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements
" To ensure that your app works correctly on the latest versions of Android, Google Play requires all apps targeting Android 15+ to support 16 KB memory page sizes.

From 1 May 2026, if your app updates do not support 16 KB memory page sizes, you won't be able to release these updates. "

Could someone guide me on this?

Thank you,

entry.title: READ_MEDIA_IMAGES and READ_MEDIA_VIDEO are automatically included in Android build in SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
I am using SAP Build Apps Free to create an app that does not use any file, image, or video widgets.

When I build the app for Android (APK/AAB), the following permissions are automatically included:

  • READ_MEDIA_IMAGES

  • READ_MEDIA_VIDEO

This causes Google Play Console to flag the app with the message:
"Your app uses undeclared photo and video permissions."

I have checked all screens and widgets, and I do not have any File Upload, Camera, or Gallery widgets.
It seems this is a default setting in the free version of SAP Build Apps.

Question:

  • Is there any way to remove these permissions in the free version?

  • Is this a known limitation/bug in SAP Build Apps Free?

  • Is there any workaround to upload the app to Google Play without these permissions being included?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Facing issues in Handling huge data in sap build apps
entry.content:
Hi,
I'm facing issue while filtering data that consists of above 2000 records i have implemented pagination and used formulas for filtering but it is filtering data for each page.

this is the first page showing result of only that page

this is another page.


i need to filter data and display it in one page.


Please suggest any solution for this issue.
Thanks,
Priyanka.

entry.title: Performance difference between SAP BTP Free Account and Paid Account?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m currently working with an SAP BTP Free Account and I’ve noticed some performance limitations when running applications and services (for example, SAP Build Apps, CAP services, and OData calls).

Before moving to a paid account, I’d like to understand:

  • Are there any performance differences (speed, responsiveness, system resources) between Free and Paid accounts?

  • Do paid accounts get more consistent service levels (e.g., CPU/memory allocation, faster response times, higher quotas)?

  • Is there any official documentation or benchmarks comparing Free vs. Paid accounts?

I’d really appreciate insights from anyone who has tested both environments or moved from Free to Paid.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to Automatically Reflect Fixed Excel Data into SAP Build Apps Input Fields?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently developing an application screen using SAP BTP Build Apps, and we would like to implement a feature that automatically reflects data from a fixed-format Excel file into input fields configured in Build Apps.

However, based on the information we’ve researched so far, we haven’t been able to find a clear method to achieve this.

Does anyone know what kind of functionality or integration we could use to make this possible?
Any advice or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your support!
Best Regards.
Yuya
